Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that President Trump was declared the winner of Pennsylvania in the presidential election on November 4, 2020, when no credible news outlets had reported a winner at that time.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or sources to back up the assertion that President Trump was declared the winner.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by acknowledging that the race has not been called yet, indicating uncertainty about the outcome.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that President Trump was declared the winner based on social media posts from individuals connected to his campaign, without considering the official declaration from authorized sources.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that the majority of the remaining uncounted mail-in ballots may favor Joe Biden, as reported by The New York Times.
